intro: Bunium persicum, commonly known as Persian cumin, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant produces oval, ribbed fruits that contain aromatic seeds used in traditional medicine and cuisine. Its roots and leaves are also utilized for their medicinal properties, including antispasmodic and carminative effects. Bunium persicum thrives in arid and semi-arid climates, often found in rocky or sandy soils.
